intro: Aphyllanthes, commonly known as the desert star, is a genus of flowering plants native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plants are typically low-growing, forming dense mats that help conserve moisture in harsh desert conditions. Aphyllanthes species are often found in rocky soils and are adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations and limited water availability. Their unique morphology and ecological adaptations make them important components of desert ecosystems.
